intro: Micrampelis polycarpa, commonly known as the tropical climbing plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Micrampelis polycarpa is native to tropical regions of Central and South America.
